body:
Comment 1: 
package flag does not attempt to implement GNU-style option parsing,
where - and -- mean different things.  In your example, -vvvv names the
flag "vvvv", whatever that is.

You can't implement something like "ls -lrt" either.
One flag per option argument.

There are various wrappings of GNU getopt, though I have not yet
seen one as nice to use as package flag.
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
